subject: Leadership
title: Inversion Thinking
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Inversion Thinking.

hook.text: Munger was asked how to live a great life. He said: 'First, figure out how to have a terrible one. Then avoid it.'

buildup.text: Inversion means thinking backward. Instead of asking how to succeed, ask what would guarantee failureâ€”then avoid it.

discovery.text: Failures are often more predictable than successes. Inverting the problem reveals risks that forward thinking misses.

twist.text: Most strategic planning focuses on what to do. Inversion adds what to never doâ€”often a more powerful constraint.

climax.text: Apply it: before launching a strategy, list ten ways it could fail. Address those first. Then build forward.

punchline.text: Avoid stupidity more reliably than you can achieve brilliance.

quiz.question: What is the core idea of inversion thinking?
options: Think backward from failure to avoid it
